alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 29 at 4:29PM EDT until September 30 at 4:35AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Connecticut... Farmington River At Unionville affecting Hartford County. Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. For the Farmington River...including Unionville, Simsbury, Tariffville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Farmington River at Unionville. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Minor flooding of lowland areas along the river is expected, and may include lowest lying homes and businesses along Route 4. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:01 PM EDT Friday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 12.6 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. If you live in a flood prone area near the Farmington River, take action now to protect your property. Plan to head to higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 430 AM EDT.
